bundle.name: GCP CloudGuard Best Practices
bundle.description: CloudGuard Best Practices for securing GCP Account

rule.name: Ensure that there are only GCP-managed service account keys for each service account
rule.description: Managing your own service account keys will result higher change for key exposure. You should avoid using user managed keys.
rule.remediation:
**From Portal**
1. Go to the IAM page in the GCP Console using https://console.cloud.google.com/iam-admin/iam
2. In the left navigation pane, click `Service accounts`. All service accounts and their corresponding keys are listed.
3. Click the service account.
4. Click the `edit` and delete the keys.

**From Command Line**
Run
```
gcloud iam service-accounts keys delete --iam-account=USER_MANAGED_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL KEY_ID
```

**References**
1. https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/iam/service-accounts/keys/delete
2. https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-service-accounts#managing_service_accounts
